    "sha": "3a0082304b709a7346fce5f70d5a7a1e6df29126",
    "filename": "docs/identity/authentication/concept-mandatory-multifactor-authentication.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 1,
    "deletions": 1,
    "changes": 2,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/c32c2a1100cb0c543cd34b1960ba84945bfc689b/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fconcept-mandatory-multifactor-authentication.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/c32c2a1100cb0c543cd34b1960ba84945bfc689b/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fconcept-mandatory-multifactor-authentication.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fconcept-mandatory-multifactor-authentication.md?ref=c32c2a1100cb0c543cd34b1960ba84945bfc689b",
    "patch": "@@ -76,7 +76,7 @@ The following table lists affected apps and URLs for Microsoft 365.\n \n All accounts that sign in to perform operations cited in the [applications section](#application-ids-and-urls) must complete MFA when the enforcement begins. Users aren't required to use MFA if they access other applications, websites, or services hosted on Azure. Each application, website, or service owner listed earlier controls the authentication requirements for users. \n \n-Break glass or emergency access accounts are also required to sign in with MFA once enforcement begins. We recommend that you update these accounts to use [passkey (FIDO2)](~/identity/authentication/how-to-enable-passkey-fido2.md) or configure [certificate-based authentication](~/identity/authentication/how-to-certificate-based-authentication.md) for MFA. Both methods satisfy the MFA requirement. \n+[Break glass or emergency access accounts](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/security-emergency-access) are also required to sign in with MFA once enforcement begins. We recommend that you update these accounts to use [passkey (FIDO2)](~/identity/authentication/how-to-enable-passkey-fido2.md) or configure [certificate-based authentication](~/identity/authentication/how-to-certificate-based-authentication.md) for MFA. Both methods satisfy the MFA requirement. \n \n Workload identities, such as managed identities and service principals, aren't impacted by [either phase](#enforcement-phases) of this MFA enforcement. If user identities are used to sign in as a service account to run automation (including scripts or other automated tasks), those user identities need to sign in with MFA once enforcement begins. User identities aren't recommended for automation. You should migrate those user identities to [workload identities](~/workload-id/workload-identities-overview.md).\n "
  },

    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fdevice-join-macos-platform-single-sign-on-multi-user-device.md?ref=c32c2a1100cb0c543cd34b1960ba84945bfc689b",
    "patch": "@@ -5,15 +5,15 @@ ms.service: entra-id\n ms.subservice: devices\n ms.topic: tutorial\n ms.date: 05/13/2023\n-ms.author: miepping\n-author: mepples21\n-manager: \n-ms.reviewer: brianmel\n+ms.author: godonnell\n+author: garrodonnell\n+manager: leventbesik\n+ms.reviewer: jploegert\n ms.custom: sfi-image-nochange\n #Customer intent: As a user I want to understand how to set up a Mac device with macOS Platform Single Sign-on (PSSO) and configure it to support multiple user login. I want to configure this device for student lab scenarios or similar multi-user Mac scenarios for shared devices.\n ---\n \n-# Join a Mac device with Microsoft Entra ID and configure it for shared device scenarios (Preview)\n+# Join a Mac device with Microsoft Entra ID and configure it for shared device scenarios\n \n In this tutorial, you will learn how to configure a Microsoft Entra Joined Mac via Mobile Device Management (MDM) to support multiple users. There are three methods in which you can register a Mac device with Platform SSO (PSSO), secure enclave, smart card, or password. We recommend using secure enclave or smart card for the best passwordless experience, however shared or multi-user Macs may benefit from using the password method instead. Common scenarios for shared Macs with passwords would be computer labs in schools or universities. In these scenarios, students use multiple devices, multiple students use the same device, and they only have passwords and no MFA or passwordless credentials.\n \n@@ -31,6 +31,14 @@ There are three main steps for configuring Platform SSO on a shared device:\n 1. **Deploy Platform SSO Configuration.** Create and deploy a settings catalog profile with the required Platform SSO Configuration.\n 1. **Deploy macOS Login Screen Configuration.** The macOS Login screen configuration can be changed to allow new users to log in.\n \n+### Shared Device Limitations\n+\n+Please note the following regarding shared macOS devices:\n+\n+- macOS devices that are intended to be shared between users should ensure they are enrolled as user-less ([enrollment w/o user affinity for ADE](/intune/intune-service/enrollment/device-enrollment-program-enroll-macos), [direct enrollment for non-ADE](/intune/intune-service/enrollment/device-enrollment-direct-enroll-macos)).\n+\n+- Conditional access policies are not supported on macOS devices that are shared with multiple users.\n+\n ### Platform SSO profile configuration\n \n Your Platform SSO MDM profile should apply the following configurations to support multi-user devices:\n@@ -39,7 +47,7 @@ Your Platform SSO MDM profile should apply the following configurations to suppo\n |-|-|-|\n | Screen Locked Behavior | Do Not Handle | Required |\n | Registration Token | {{DEVICEREGISTRATION}} | Recommended for the best registration user experience |\n-| Authentication Method | Password | Recommended for this article, secure enclave key is recommended for single user devices |\n+| Authentication Method | Password, smartcard, secure enclave|During new user creation at the login screen, user will need to specify a user name and password regardless of the auth method chosen.|\n | Enable Authorization | Enabled | Required |\n | Enable Create User At Login | Enabled | Required |\n | New User Authorization Mode | Standard | Recommended |\n@@ -60,7 +68,7 @@ If you use Intune as your MDM of choice, then the configuration profile settings\n \n To allow new users to log on and be created from the macOS login screen, there are two configurations that can be used:\n \n- - **Show Other Users Managed**. With this configuration, the macOS login screen shows a list of profiles that have been created and an \"other user\" button that can be used to log in with a username and password. Users can select their existing profile to log in or log in with their Microsoft Entra ID user principal name (UPN).\n+- **Show Other Users Managed**. With this configuration, the macOS login screen shows a list of profiles that have been created and an \"other user\" button that can be used to log in with a username and password. Users can select their existing profile to log in or log in with their Microsoft Entra ID user principal name (UPN).\n     \n  - **Show full name**. With this configuration, the macOS login screen displays and username and password field with no list of users. Users can log in with their Microsoft Entra ID UPN.\n "
  },

]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response:
This commit introduces several updates to the Microsoft Entra documentation. Key changes include:

*   The addition of "Azure Cloud Services for Government" to a list of known GUIDs.
*   A correction to a link regarding break-glass accounts in the mandatory multi-factor authentication concept document.
*   An update to the tutorial for joining macOS devices with Microsoft Entra ID, clarifying limitations for shared devices and refining authentication method descriptions.
*   A minor revision to a role override entry in the role-based access control documentation.
